results.title: Inhabitants: their activities
results.brief_description:
Episode number 2 of Series “Microcosms of the Mouth”.
A documentation of the discovery of an details of microcosms living in the “scum” covering our teeth. Many microscopic pictures of microcosms and lots of scientific terms used.

results.title: Ingrid Goes West
results.brief_description: Ingrid becomes obsessed with a social network star named Taylor Sloane who seemingly has a perfect life. But when Ingrid decides to drop everything and move west to be Taylor’s friend, her behaviour turns unsettling and dangerous.

constellations_other.name: Reality TV me
constellations_other.description: Cult documentary Grey Gardens follows the everyday eccentricities of mother and daughter Big Edie and Little Edie. The women perform and speak candidly to the camera, and have been described as predecessors to reality TV stars.

results.description: Ingrid becomes obsessed with a social network star named Taylor Sloane who seemingly has a perfect life. But when Ingrid decides to drop everything and move west to be Taylor’s friend, her behaviour turns unsettling and dangerous.

results.title: Ingrid Bergman: a woman of courage
results.creator_credit: Gene Feldman, Suzette Winter and Wombat Productions, Inc.
results.brief_description: Ingrid Bergman, winner of three Academy Awards, was one of Hollywood’s and the world’s most beloved and respected stars. Whatever her role, be it barmaid or Joan of Arc, to millions she embodied all that was decent and wholesome in womanhood…until she dared to follow her own heart. Narrated by John Gielgud.

results.title: Ingress (2013)
results.brief_description: Ingress (or Ingress Prime) is an augmented reality (AR) mobile game developed and published by Niantic for Android and iOS devices.

constellations_other.name: Location and exploration
constellations_other.description: A comparative look at location-based gaming and street art and how the way we experience these two art forms has moved out of traditional spaces and onto the street.

results.description: Welcome to the world of Ingress, Agent. The discovery of XM, a mysterious resource of unknown origin, has sparked a covert struggle between two distinct Factions.
description_for_label: Welcome to the world of Ingress, Agent. The discovery of XM, a mysterious resource of unknown origin, has sparked a covert struggle between two distinct Factions.

results.title: Ingredients of love
results.creator_credit: Jenni Klempfner, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Jenni Klempfner explores her ancestors’ Polish and Jewish heritage as well as her own multi-cultural family. This Digital Storytelling project was created in partnership with the Jewish Museum of Australia.

results.title: Ingredients of an effective speech
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Speaking with confidence”.
‘Ingredients of a speech’ addresses speaking rate, volume, voice projection, use of light and shade and the use of pausing for delivering an effective speech.

results.title: Ingmar Bergman
results.creator_credit: Stig Bjorkman, Stattan Hedqvist and Svenska filminstitutet
results.brief_description: Ingmar Bergman is widely acknowledged by film critics as adopting an intellectual stance towards film making, as well as being one of the great directors of actors. This documentary includes clips from his films and indicates his working relationships with actors. The film also brings out the requirements involved in being a film director. Suitable for upper secondary level.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Stig Bjorkman, Stattan Hedqvist and Svenska filminstitutet

results.title: Inglourious Basterds
results.headline_credit: Germany and United States of America, 2009
results.brief_description: In Nazi-occupied France during World War II, a group of Jewish-American soldiers known as “The Basterds” are chosen specifically to spread fear throughout the Third Reich by scalping and brutally killing Nazis.

constellations_other.name: Splicing history and silencing the lambs
constellations_other.description: With plastic strips coated with light-sensitive emulsions, film strips captured light and created moving pictures. In this Constellation we trace celluloid and splicing as plot device to serial killers, secrets agents and Super 8.

constellations_other.name: Analogue and digital film
constellations_other.description: Though technology has evolved since celluloid film strips were invented, contemporary filmmakers and artists still appreciate and celebrate the analogue in a digital world.

constellations_other.name: Movies in movies in a movie museum
constellations_other.description: The 400 Porto-Arc 16mm projector used the first electric light ever invented, which was perfectly suited for movie projectors. This Constellation explores the movies where characters go to the movies, by two movie-obsessed directors.

results.description: In Nazi-occupied France during World War II, a group of Jewish-American soldiers known as “The Basterds” are chosen specifically to spread fear throughout the Third Reich by scalping and brutally killing Nazis. The Basterds, lead by Lt. Aldo Raine soon cross paths with a French-Jewish teenage girl who runs a movie theater in Paris which is targeted by the soldiers.
description_for_label: In Nazi-occupied France during World War II, a group of Jewish-American soldiers known as “The Basterds” are chosen specifically to spread fear throughout the Third Reich by scalping and brutally killing Nazis. The Basterds, lead by Lt. Aldo Raine soon cross paths with a French-Jewish teenage girl who runs a movie theater in Paris which is targeted by the soldiers.

results.title: Inganarr the giant serpent
results.creator_credit: Ken J. Widdowson, Educational Media Australia and Australian National University
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Aboriginal legends”.
A serpent with an enormous appetite, Inganarr, ate all the people of North Goulburn Island and then proceeded to eat the people of Arnhem Land. Fortunately Inganarr suffered from indigestion due to his gluttony and the tribespeople poured out of his mouth in droves. This helps to explain why there are people in eastern Arnhem Land but no people in western Arnhem Land. This film is also available as a compilation film entitled Aboriginal legends no. 3. Suitable for middle and upper primary level.
